scenario_text.value:
Something bothering you, Aoi? You seem
a little out of it.
Oh, Takuma...

It’s nothing, really. I was just thinking
back over all that’s happened...

Remembering what it was like after we first
came here.

For me, living in this world has been...
Well, I’m not sure how to put it exactly...

(Seems like Aoi’s having a hard time finding
the right words. Maybe I should help.)
(What’s she trying to say?)
It wasn’t all bad.
Everything was awful.
It wasn’t all bad.

You mean you feel like not everything about
our time here was bad?

Yes, exactly. I mean, sure, a lot of things
were hard, and sad things happened too...

But for some reason, looking back, it’s the
good things, the fun times, that stand out.
Everything was awful.

Are you talking about how awful everything
was? Like this was all a series of trials?

Yeah, pretty much. I’m not saying it was
anyone’s fault, though.

I think maybe I wasn’t cut out to run things.
I kept wishing we could just go home already.

Don’t worry, we’ll beat the Master and go
home. Until then, hang in there. I’m with you.
Yeah...
See? That wasn’t such a hard thing to say.

I guess not. You don’t think that came across
as inappropriate?
Not at all. Why would you think it was?

Because I don’t trust all my decisions. Maybe
I made things harder than they needed to be.

(Hmm, I feel like that’s going too far. But
Aoi does tend to put everything on herself.)

I appreciate your sense of responsibility,
Aoi, but try not to take things too far.

If you’re going to look back on what
happened, try to focus on the good stuff.
Like what?

I don’t know. What would you say was the best
thing about coming here?

Well, a lot of good things happened, but
I think the best was meeting each other.
(Meeting each other? Who does she mean?)
Meeting all of us?
Meeting Labramon?
Meeting all of us?
Meeting all of us?
Yes. You and Minoru and...
Me too, right?
Yes, of course you too, Labramon!
I’m so glad we all became such good friends.
Meeting Labramon?
You mean meeting Labramon?
Yes, of course, but not just that...
It was pretty great, wasn’t it?
Hey, Aoi...

Let’s stay friends, even after you go back to
your world, okay?
Yeah...

You know, you’re right. We wouldn’t be where
we are now if it weren’t for each other.

It all started with us coming here from that
shrine. Then we met Labramon and the others,

climbed that radio tower, went to the
amusement park... We’ve been through a lot.
Yes, we really have.

And after we defeat the Master, everyone will
go home. That makes me feel kind of lonely.
Yeah...me too.
(Aoi must not want to leave Labramon.)
(I’ll tell Aoi that...)
...you could stay.
...you’ll be friends.
...you could stay.
You could just stay in this world.

Hee hee, maybe that’s not such a bad idea.
What do you think, Labramon?
Aoi!

Don’t even joke about that! You’ve got your
own life you need to live.

So I don’t want you talking about that, okay?
It just makes me feel that much lonelier.
Okay. I’m sorry, Labramon.

Yeah, I’m sorry too. I shouldn’t have brought
that up so casually.
...you’ll stay close.

Even though the two of you will be apart,
you’ll still be friends.
Yes, that’s true. We’ll stay friends forever.

I’ll never forget about you, even after I go
back.
Yeah! Never, ever, ever forget!
Aoi!!!
Labramon...

You know, Takuma, for everything we’ve been
through, I think it’s all been worthwhile.

No, I want to make sure it’s all been
worthwhile. Which is just one more reason...

...we need to rescue Miyuki, and save both
worlds.
Yeah, let’s do it!

I’m never going to forget what happened in
this world. Not ever.
